ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
In the past 6 months, how much have you improved your management of patients with oppositional or aggressive behavior?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little bit; 3=Moderately; 4=Quite a lot; 999=Missing

ElementDescription: In the past 6 months, how much have you improved your management of patients with ADHD?
Notes: 1=Not at all; 2=A little bit; 3=Moderately; 4=Quite a lot; 999=Missing

ElementDescription: How skilled are you in providing the following services for patients with oppositional or aggressive behavior: Diagnosis of Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD) and/or Conduct Disorder (CD)?
Notes: 1=Not skilled at all; 2=Slightly skilled; 3=Somewhat skilled; 4=Very skilled; 999=Missing

ElementDescription: How skilled are you in providing the following services for patients with oppositional or aggressive behavior: Education, counseling, and treatment?
Notes: 1=Not skilled at all; 2=Slightly skilled; 3=Somewhat skilled; 4=Very skilled; 999=Missing

ElementDescription: How likely are you to treat a youth with ADHD with stimulant medications if the youth has the following: Comorbid Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD) and/or Conduct Disorder (CD)?
How likely are you to treat a youth with ADHD with stimulant medications if the youth has the following: Comorbid Anxiety and/or Depressive Disorder?
How likely are you to treat a youth with ADHD with stimulant medications if the youth has the following: The family appears to have difficulty implementing structure?
